page.title: 08Trethosa Methodist Chapel
page.content: The chapel which was built in 1876 is well-maintained and still active.There was a lively centenary celebration in 1976 although Methodist activities are recorded in an earlier building erected at the beginning of the 19th century at Trethosa Farm. A poem by {Jack Clemo - "Bethel Centenary"} was written to mark the occasion and printed in the celebratory booklet. The section beneath the chapel was the original Trethosa School from 1891 until the current building was erected in 1900. The{Sunday School,}initiated in the ealier farm building, has been held in the section below the chapel since its construction. The area has a strong Methodist tradition and on a number of occasions (e.g.May1895) the school was closed to allow a{Rechabite {demonstration}to take place.
